block.p: LEAD: Wang Laboratories Inc. yesterday announced a series of local area network software products that the company said would integrate its minicomputers and word processors more closely with I.B.M.-compatible personal computers. The company also outlined a strategy focusing on the office automation market and attempting to replace traditional paper-based filing systems with electronic document retrieval.

LEAD: Wang Laboratories Inc. yesterday announced a series of local area network software products that the company said would integrate its minicomputers and word processors more closely with I.B.M.-compatible personal computers. The company also outlined a strategy focusing on the office automation market and attempting to replace traditional paper-based filing systems with electronic document retrieval.

Wang Laboratories Inc. yesterday announced a series of local area network software products that the company said would integrate its minicomputers and word processors more closely with I.B.M.-compatible personal computers. The company also outlined a strategy focusing on the office automation market and attempting to replace traditional paper-based filing systems with electronic document retrieval.
Wang also announced that the company had entered an agreement with Banyan Systems Inc. to resell several Banyan networking products as part of the new Wang PC LAN.
